Message.Title: Why China’s lousy deposit rates could mean big business for Alibaba
Message.Msg: To make sure the banks have enough money to lend, the Chinese government sets deposit rates that are usually much lower than what banks can charge for loans, and oftentimes even lower than inflation—meaning that keeping your cash in the bank actually loses you money. Alibaba launched a time-deposit service offering 6.299%—a lot better than the 3.25% you can get at one of the state banks. Its 2.5 million users have already deposited $1 billion. A source told Caixin that the total amount of invested funds is growing by $45 million each day!!!!

Message.Title: independent oil corps
Message.Msg: now its obviously easy to mock rtd corp (australian stk exchg) based on its penny stock status.......but i herein suggest that rtd is a person.........the force behind rtd is a single person who utilizes the tool called a "public corporation" to accomplish his personal goals. thats what (it seems to me) these independent oil companies are all about. some of them, like great bear stay private (no stock exchange ) and some like royl and rtd utilize the benefits offered by being a public corp. notice that great bear petro llc is the vision of a person named Ed Duncan, geologist w/vast alaskan experience. royl corp is the hosmer family company. rtd has its one person visionary. now i note that ed duncan scooped up 500.,000 acres on leasehold, in north slope. futher, ed duncan got deep pocket major corp HALLIBURTON to be its partner on north slope. by the way,,,, ive read more than a few articles placing the hosmers and ed duncan on the same lecturn/platform/location.........telling me they are not just acquaintances and i believe there is likely a helping hand relationship involved (just my impression). now this penny rtd stock , i believe is misguidedly mocked when in fact the man behind rtd is known for ability to raise big funds and to make big deals. the entire point of this post is just to express notion the people behind these tiny companies are folks that make things happen and i would expect royl & rtd thought this agreement thru from beginning to end before they shook hands & signed.
great,.,...wrong frickin mb.......... im not gonna retype this #$%$...........lol

copy and paste it..put cursor at beginning of first word in paragraph, then pull mouse down and toward lower right, text will be highlited in blue, pull it down to last letter of last word and release. the press CTTL (CONTROL - usually bottom of keyboard at the left) and while holding down CTRL push the letter "c" (for copy) then go to the correct messageboard and start a "new topic" when the screen comes up, put the cursor in the places where you type the message, that is "set the cursor" into the text box...then press CTRL again, and while holding CTRL down, press "V" as in victor...that will paste the message you copied into the new message text area...copy and paste

Message.Title: DRAM $3.9 UP 6% ..12-MONTH TARGET: $30+ WHY???: 1) RAISING 2013 MEMORY PRICES, 2) NEW MEMORY/SOFTWARE MANUFACTURING DEAL WITH AMD
Message.Msg: DRAM is THE BEST VALUE UNDER $10....Here is why 1) DRAM’s fundamentals and the price that can support have increased exponentially within the last three months (see reasons below) 2) Dataram Corp. (NASDAQ: DRAM) is trading at 60c/share pre recent 6/1 reverse split. This is 1/10 of the 2010 share price. 3) DRAM is trading at 0.2 current and 0.1 projected X sales vs. 1.5 sector average 4) Current market cap: $7 million 5) Forecast 12-month revenues: : $50 million 6) Forward 12-month net income: $1/share Reasons for recent improvement in fundamentals: 1. DRAM/memory prices have increased almost 90% this year according to the DRAM Index (DXI – do web search for dram exchange for DXI chart). This is DRAM's core business. 2. Rich AMD manufacturing deal (announced by both companies in May 2013) calls for: A) DRAM to manufacture AMD’s Gamer Series memory modules for gaming enthusiast currently selling at $155 at Newegg, and B) AMD to use DRAM’s RAMDisk software technology in all its Radeon and Gamer Series product lines. DRAM’s CEO John Freeman stated the following during the last earnings report for the quarter ending 1/31/2013 (before memory prices literally exploded upwards and before the AMD deals were inked):..... “The economy and especially the semiconductor industry continued to be soft during most of the Company’s third quarter, due to oversupply of raw materials and reduced customer infrastructure investment. Since the close of our third quarter on January 31, 2013 we have seen an increase in pricing which can positively impact our memory business for the balance of the fiscal year and beyond.” Mr. Freeman concluded, “In addition to a healthier semiconductor industry, we continue to develop and expand our relationship with Advanced Micro Devices, Inc., which together with our RAMDisk agreement and other new opportunities we are currently pursuing should provide new sources of revenue, profit and growth for Dataram in 2013 and beyond."
